to 6 laid flat 5½ to 6½ larger hat adjust 4th row to 46 double_crochet as base to make 12 shells for 12 5 circumference smaller hat adjust 4th row to 42 double_crochet as base to make 11 shells for 11 5 circumference round 1 form a slip ring pull up a loop next to the knot chain 3 11 double_crochet into the ring pull the ring tight as described below join with slip_stitch to top of beg chain 3 12 round 2 chain 3 double_crochet in same st 2 double_crochet in next st and each around join with slip_stitch to top of beg chain 3 24 round 3 chain 3 double_crochet in same st *1dc in next 2 double_crochet in next repeat from * around join with slip_stitch to top of beg chain 3 36 round 4 chain 3 double_crochet in same st *1 double_crochet in each of next 3 double_crochet 2 double_crochet in next repeat from * around making 2 double_crochet in last st 10 increases to total 46 double_crochet as needed for shells row join with slip_stitch to top of beg chain 3 or make 6 increases to total 42 double_crochet for smaller hat round 5 begin shells do not chain begin with the slip_stitch end of round 4 *skip 1 3 double_crochet skip 1 single_crochet continue around from * end row with 3 double_crochet in the last double_crochet of round 4 rounds 6-16 single_crochet in center double_crochet of first 3dc cluster of round 5 skip 1dc 3 double_crochet in single_crochet of previous row *skip 1 single_crochet skip 1 3 double_crochet continue around from * without joining so that the center of each shell is stitched in the single_crochet between shells of the previous row end off with a slip_stitch in the center of a shell of the previous row and weave in ends a slip ring is formed the same as the slip knot used to start a chain except that the loose end is the one to pull tight after crocheting round 1 into the loop form the loop and leave it open about ½ inch pull up a loop next to the knot to start crocheting into the loop as you would a chained loop when round 1 is complete pull the loose end as tight as you want the hole closed up and weave the end in around the center to make a sturdy center the slip ring works well for crocheting in the round where the center is to be fairly tightly closed these instructions are included here
